title: How to Drum on "Rock Band"

steps.headline: Learn the song.
steps.description: Knowing how the song sounds is a huge part of it. So either already know the song or you should download it. Legally of course. Or listen to the song online through a source like www.projectplaylist.com

steps.headline: Play the song on an easier level - If you're stuck on a song play it on a lower level.
steps.description: This will get you familiar with the song in an easier form. Then work up to the level you need.

steps.headline: Don't be afraid to practice.
steps.description: Go to practice mode frequently. Slow it down or work on a hard section.

steps.headline: This is most important.
steps.description: While practicing in practice mode, start with just learning the notes without the bass drum. Once you know the rhythm on the notes, add the bass drum. Also, you can just practice without the bass drum and then just practice the bass drum and put them together.

steps.headline: Foot tired?
steps.description: Don't keep your foot on the upbeat whenever it's not playing. Rest it by keeping it pressed down when there isn't a note for the bass. Also, practice with shoes and take them off when you're attempting during a show.

steps.headline: Get the right foot pedal position.
steps.description: Have your foot on the pedal with the balls of your feet on the edge of the top of the pedal. It increases stamina and responds faster. Keep your heel up!

steps.headline: Select the right stick weight.
steps.description: Use the same stick weight at all times. It is recommended to use a 5A weight and size. Practicing with heavy sticks, then not playing with the heavy sticks will hurt you more than help you.
